page.title: 19LORISTON COUNTRY PARK 1
page.content: The most northerly part of Loriston Country Park lies within our D-block, although what actually exists does not fufill ones expectations of a Country Park. The idea of designating the area a Country Park was put forward by the Council in 1970 with ambitious plans to cater for golfers,birdwatchers, walkers and picnickers.Simultaneously local farming was to be maintained thus creating and preserving a 'country atmosphere".Even then there was some sceptism about the proposals when one considered the actual location and in reality these plans have never come to fruition. One of the major features of the "park"today is the City's domestic and industrial refuse tip where about 800 tonnes of pulverised rubbish is produced and dumped every week.Added
